event: Giuseppe Piazzi discovered Ceres, the first and largest asteroid in the asteroid belt (1801)
Luna 1 became the first spacecraft to reach the vicinity of the Moon and orbit the Sun (1959)
NASA's Spirit rover successfully landed on Mars (2004)
Birth of Sir Isaac Newton, who formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation (1643)
Discovery of Eris, a dwarf planet in the scattered disc region (2005)
Galileo observed Jupiter's largest moons for the first time, supporting heliocentrism (1610)
Galileo discovered the first three moons of Jupiter: Io, Europa, and Ganymede (1610)
Birth of Stephen Hawking, known for work on black holes and cosmology (1942)
Launch of the Einstein Probe to study high-energy astrophysical phenomena (2024)
Project Diana successfully reflected radar signals off the Moon (1946)
William Herschel discovered Uranus' largest moons, Titania and Oberon (1787)
Launch of NASAâ€™s Deep Impact mission to study comet Tempel 1 (2005)
Galileo discovered Callisto, the fourth Galilean moon of Jupiter (1610)
Huygens probe landed on Saturnâ€™s moon Titan, sending first images of its surface (2005)
NASAâ€™s Stardust mission returned with comet samples from Wild 2 (2006)
Soyuz 4 and Soyuz 5 performed the first crew transfer between spacecraft (1969)
Birth of Benjamin Franklin, a pioneer in electricity research (1706)
Discovery of Pallas, the second known asteroid (1779)
Launch of NASAâ€™s New Horizons mission to Pluto (2006)
First known exoplanets discovered orbiting a pulsar (1993)
Luna 24 returned lunar soil samples to Earth (1978)
NASAâ€™s MESSENGER spacecraft conducted its first Mercury flyby (2008)
United States Exploring Expedition confirmed the existence of Antarctica (1840)
Voyager 2 made its closest approach to Uranus, capturing detailed images (1986)
The European Space Agency formally adopted the LISA mission to detect gravitational waves (2024)
Launch of the International Ultraviolet Explorer telescope (1978)
Apollo 1 tragedy occurred during a pre-flight test, leading to safety improvements (1967)
Space Shuttle Challenger disaster during launch, resulting in the loss of seven astronauts (1986)
Galileo observed Neptune, mistakenly identifying it as a fixed star (1613)
Launch of Ranger 6 to capture close-up images before impacting the Moon (1964)
Explorer 1, the first American satellite, was launched, leading to the discovery of the Van Allen radiation belts (1958)
